thread.title: Across the country, resistance to Republican plan to take away health care from millions
thread.title_full: Across the country, resistance to Republican plan to take away health care from millions

author: rss@dailykos.com (Barbara Morrill)
title: Across the country, resistance to Republican plan to take away health care from millions
text:
0 
On Sunday, people across the country gathered to tell Republicans to give up on their plan to rip away health care to millions of Americans: 
Democrats and labor organizers spent Sunday at dozens of rallies across the country, pledging to fight in Congress against the repeal of the Affordable Care Act and any attempt to change Medicare or Medicaid. The party's leaders faced crowds ranging in size from dozens to thousands of people, urging them to call Republicans and protest the push for repeal. [...] 
In Bowie [Maryland], a number of rally attendees said they were also planning to join the Women's March to be held in Washington, D.C., the day after Trump's inauguration. [...] 
… some of the loudest cheers came when Rep. Jamie Raskin, D-Md., said he "might end up voting to impeach" Trump, and one activist interrupted House Minority Whip Steny Hoyer and urged him to "boycott the inauguration" like Rep. John Lewis, D-Ga. 
In Boston, Sen. Elizabeth Warren told more than 6,000 people: 
“We knew these fights were coming, and now the first one is here,” Warren told the crowd, “We will fight them every step of the way.” 
Every. Damn. Step. 
Meanwhile, in Colorado, Republican Rep. Mike Coffman, ran away rather than facing his constituents who wanted to tell him to keep his grubby hands off their health care. Coward. 
Head below for just a few great images of resistance around the country, and add your own! x

Kicking off Trump inauguration week w a message: you're not gonna throw tens of millions of Americans off healthcare w/o a hell of a fight pic.twitter.com/Yp6mS957fF — Scott Wiener (@Scott_Wiener) January 15, 2017 x 
100s of nurses and #healthcare activists take over NYC. Americans deserve guaranteed healthcare, they deserve #Medicare4All ! #SundayMorning pic.twitter.com/mHfUvYzkif
